abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Emergency Food
            Security Support Project is to support the government
            efforts to mitigate the impact of food price crisis through:
            (a) increase of rice production with procurement and
            distribution of fertilizers to rice producers at affordable
            prices ; and (b) providing technical assistance to enhance
            the capacity of the Food Crisis Prevention and Management
            Framework's (FCPMF) coordination unit and executing
            agencies, for the management of the project and for improved
            monitoring of the country's food security. The present
            study is to determine and evaluate the environmental and
            social impacts of the activities which will be carried out
            for the project and to define the attenuation and
            improvement measures, the monitoring measures as well as the
            institutional measures to be taken during the implementation
            of the project in order to cancel, attenuate or improve the
            potential unfavorable environmental and social impacts or to
            carry them at acceptable levels. The activities which must
            be considered as potential sources of positive and negative
            impacts are the acquisition and the setting up of
            fertilizers, the storage, transport and distribution of
            fertilizers, the collect and the re-use of the empty
            packing, the application of fertilizers and pesticides,. The
            components of the medium susceptible to be affected by the
            activities source of impacts and on which the impact
            evaluation is focused are: the water resources, soils,
            sensitive ecological areas, flora, fauna, (aquatic and
            terrestrial), life conditions of the populations, health and
            population security, socio-economic activities.
